Reviews.Title: “Restful Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen P
Reviews.Content: Returning to Rome after 10 yrs I knew I didn't want to stay on Via Venuto as I had before, so I chose the Lord Bryon, and it was the right choice. After walking and touring the city and surrounding areas each day, returning to the LBH each evening was the perfect way to end each perfect day. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating and welcoming. Special thanks to Luca who drove us around and to Nicola who made sure our nightcap was awaiting our return.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel experience in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Lori P
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the best hotel. Everyone there was so nice and helpful. The room was gorgeous, spotless and large, as was the bathroom. The amenities were really nice. The breakfast buffet was a delicious variety of pastries, cereal, eggs, smoked fish, cheeses a variety of juices, coffee and teas. The hotel was right at The Borghese Park which is also something spectacular. It was close enough to all the great tourist attractions by cab or walk through the park but also in a very beautiful part of the city. I can't recommend this place enough and will definitely stay here again whenever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lord Byron might sleep here...”
Reviews.Author: TommyBars
Reviews.Content: nicely sized well-appointed room...very nice included breakfast including carafes of coffee for those wishing a break from espresso. Staff incredibly attentive (ask for both Andreas!) hotel bar downstairs with a piano very comfortable after a long day of sightseeing One warning, the location, above the Borghese Gardens may be a tad off the beaten track for some folks...you will need to walk through/around the gardens or get a cab to get places, including the Metro. (and its all downhill from the hotel...) All in all, we loved this hotel and would return here when next in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: gakpa
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed at anywhere. The two "terrible" reviews must be about a different hotel. Our room was fairly large, comfortable and well appointed, with a large bath room and an entrance foyer with a closet and plenty of drawer space. The staff was friendly, attentive and very helpful, particularly Andrea, the concierge, and the barman Nicola. We knew beforehand that it is not centrally located and that there are no inexpensive restaurants nearby, but this is more than offset by the beautiful and tranquil area in which it is located. The hotel restaurant is excellent, as is the nearby Pagoroma. Also nearby is the not quite as good but more moderately priced Ambasciata d' Abruzzo. The buffet breakfast had almost anything you would want, from cereals and yogurt to eggs, cheeses, smoked salmon, fruit, breads and pastries. I cannot recommend this hotel too highly. A special attraction for me was the very fine collection of Art Deco furniture and decorative arts. The public areas are filled with many museum pieces - wood and upholstered furniture, lamps, tables, bronzes and more.

Reviews.Title: “A WEEKEND VISIT TO A WONDERFUL CITY”
Reviews.Author: Clive L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly service in a peaceful location, a good 20 minute walk into the centre of Rome, so if you are in need of good excercise then it is a pleasant walk through the park of Villa Borghesi. Because of the location and having had lots of excersice you will be tempted to have dinner in the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was excellent however we had dinner in the restaurant on two occasions ,on one evening it was pleasant , however on the Saturday evening, the food was poor. The service was excellent however I felt that even the waiter was uncomfortable about the quality of the food being served. The rooms were comfortable if slightly dated, however we felt that it was good value in comparrison to many hotels in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with an Elegant Art Deco Villa Feel!”
Reviews.Author: MTD-Travel-Reviewer
Reviews.Content: The Lord Bryron hotel feels like an elegant Art Deco villa. The rooms, lobby and breakfast room are very nicely decorated. Beautiful carpets, marbel and paintings. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is located at an upscale residential neighberhood near the Borghese Gardens. It is about a 20 minutes walk to Piazza di Spagna at the heart of Rome. The metro stop is 15 minutes walk. So the location is not ideal if you like to be located right in the center of the tourist sites, however, walking the beautiful streets of Rome is a pleasure, and we even walked to the Vatican (about half an hour). We had the Classic room which is somewhat small for a five star hotel, however, the room was functional and adequate for 2 adults with 2 large suitcases. The mirror in the bathrooms had permanent stains and should be replaced. Other than the mirror, the room was beautiful. Being on the lower floor, we could hear when people above us were showering a sound of water falling. Not a big deal. Breakfast is tasty, the cappucinno great. Overall I highly recommend this elegant boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A refuge in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jedavis4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lord Byron was nearly perfect. The service was impeccable. Breakfast was wonderful. The walk to the Metro stop at Flaminia was 15 minutes. When in a hurry - like to get to the Vatican - we grabbed a taxi for 10 euro. We did walk back. Restaurants in the area are Ambriatta de Abruzzo and Pagaroma - we went to both twice for dinner. We recommend the Lord Byron without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights at Hotel Lord Byron and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is situated in a very quiet residential district close to the Borghese Gardens. The tranquil location provides an excellent oasis away from the tourist areas of the city. We enjoy walking so being able to walk through the peaceful environment of gardens to the main attractions of central Rome provided a great way to start and end each day. We stayed in a Junior Suite on the 4th floor with a small balcony overlooking a park. The suite was spacious enough for our needs with excellent closet and bathroom amenities. With complimentary Wi-Fi this was also an added bonus. The rooms are fitted with electric shutters which ensures a very quiet room with little or no morning light which enhanced our sleeping along with the firm beds which we greatly appreciate when travelling. The furnishings and art work in the hotel were for us outstanding. As collectors of Art Deco furniture we were delighted to enjoy such lush furnishings and surroundings in every area of the hotel. The standard of service at the hotel was totally exemplary - from our room maid ( best ever ) to all the front desk staff this a major feature of the hotel. Special mention must be made of the service provided by Nicola , the barman/sommelier in the hotel restaurant. We thoroughly enjoyed his recommendations and conversations during our stay. This hotel provided us with a home away from home and we will always be staying there in our future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendly, respectuous and attentive to your needs”
Reviews.Author: Guiness06410
Reviews.Content: not sure that it should be classed as a 5 star hotel .... 4 star without question. Very quiet location and need to take a taxi to get to any of the centres of Rome (yes there are more than one centre) ..... Taxi between 7 - 8 Euros to Vatican or Trevi Fountain. Breakfast is (just) OK but service was long with coffee and eggs taking 5 mins+. Room (304) had a small balcony but a little sparse on furniture - recommend that the hotel management put an armchair in the corner ... bed hard but comfortable, bathroom very luxe but the shower is fixed to the wall so (Ladies) forget about washing your hair without taking a full shower. Well insulated rooms and the Lobby, Bar, Restaurant areas are all well appointed with ArtDeco and Antiques. In summary ... A nice comfortable, clean and quiet hotel but far from the restaurants & night life of central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: DavidandGillian
Reviews.Content: A small, very stylish 5 star hotel on the edge of Borghese Park just a 10 minute stroll to Flamini piazza; then another 5 minutes to the centre of Rome and most shops/attractions such as the Spanish Steps. The staff are wonderful and help in every way possible. Andrea, the concierge has great English and can arrange everything from the best restaurants, where the Itailians eat, to limousine transfers to and from the Fiumicino. Massimo and other front of house staff made the stay welcoming and everybody seemed at ease which made us at ease too. Unless you have a need to be in the very heart of Rome this is absolutely ideal. Andrea booked all our guided tours at about 59 euros per person and Francesca, who showed us around the Forum, was a star and worth asking for by name. Can't wait to go back. We both loved every minute and the December weather was 17'!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience in Tranquil Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron is an incredibly unique property, and a stunning example of Italian early Art Deco design. Located in the quiet (and slightly off the beaten path) neighbourhood of Parioli, the hotel feels like a luxurious private villa. All of the public spaces (the lobby, bar, and dining room in particular) have been restored perfectly and decorated in fabulous taste. The original Deco antiques and portraits throughout made the space feel personal and thoughtful, and grand without being imposing. Our room (on the fourth floor, at the rear of the hotel), while not overly plush was grand, stylish, and comfortable. The room felt very airy and spacious, with high ceilings and tall French doors opening onto a crescent shaped balcony. The beds were firm, but the luxe bathroom and ample closet made up for this. The service was superb, and the staff was attentive without being overbearing. The concierge in particular was very good and consistently made excellent restaurant recommendations. The location though isolated from central Rome, provided respite from the chaos. Perhaps not the ideal location for first-time travellers to Rome, but staying in Parioli gives a new perspective on the city. On the whole, Lord Byron is a treasure, and it's one of the few hotels at which I have stayed that I could even envision myself living there.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: greatstay2010
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending eight nights at this hotel; I cannot say enough about the FANTASTIC service and charm and even location of this hotel. Upon our arrival, the gentleman at the reception mentioned that he hoped we would feel at home during our stay, and we certainly did. Our family celebration could NEVER have been as wonderful without the support of the staff at the Lord Byron; the hotel staff is uniformly reliable, thoughtful, forthcoming with advice when asked, and respectful, and I must say these attributes are difficult to find in this day and age. The hotel itself is updated with the best of ammenities and yet still retains its lovely ambiance.. The breakfast buffet was terrific, and the hotel's location was ideal. What more can one ask.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bphenry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here as part of a recent 20th wedding anniversary trip to Italy and were very pleased with our choice. Located on the north side of the Villa Borghese, it is an oasis of calm and quiet slightly outside the chaos that can be Rome. Don't let the location deter you, though, as a cab stand is nearby and it is a short and reasonable trip to most common destinations. If you (like we) enjoy walking, it is a pleasant stroll down through the park to the Piazza del Popolo (one of Fellini's hang outs and home to two stunning Caravaggios at Santa Maria del Popolo), and we even walked back from the Vatican following an early morning tour. At less than thirty rooms, the service is very personalized and consistently courteous and friendly. Of particular note for us was barman and sommelier Nicola Grieco. This is a barman of the old school as in a Hemingway novel: impeccable service and presence, not familiar, but a delight to converse with should you choose to do so. Plus the barroom he runs is an art deco gem. We may return to Rome just to have another martini and bottle of wine with Mr. Grieco. We booked a junior suite and, although not large, it was very comfortable with a small balcony overlooking the park. The room was so quiet and dark that, somewhat jet lagged, we normally early risers inadvertently slept to 11:30 the first morning. If you want action and the large hotel scene the Lord Byron is not for you. But if you want one that gives you a respite from the days and nights activity, do book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “hotel (5star)”
Reviews.Author: cody4512
Reviews.Content: not a 5 star hotel. we had a suite and it was very small. but we expected this been rome, food and service very average, value for money very poor. however we ere outside rome and opposite some embassey and felt very safe. lift in hotel very scary breakfast average, dinner and wine very expensive. but overall not bad but NOT a 5 star hotel maybe 3 at best. i'm begining to think i am becoming to fussy.

Reviews.Title: “not nice enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: i-live-for-lunch
Reviews.Content: here's a strange one. Its in all the luxury guides and Relais & Chateau and what not. It talks a good talk, the lobby is nice, the staff friendly enough, but at the end of the day, you are left with a strange feeling of not having got enough out of it. First, lets be clear, the location is not good. Not terrible, in a nice residential neighborhood, but if you are out of time, you will be taking a cab to and from here all the time. Silly; you'd be better off in town. And then there are the rools; not uncomfortable of course, but really too small, and with that bizarre Italian design, when it comes up bad. More of an Alfa Romeo than a Ferrari. There are better places in town.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: The style, elegance and quality of service were in every detail of this excellent hotel. The rooms were a good size and had every necessary amenity. Free soft drinks bar in room, free wifi and complimentary buffet breakfast. The staff were simply AMAZING, helpful, knowledgable and sincere. They were there to help and did, no fuss just great. The bed was a little firm for me, but that is what you get on the continent. That said it was a quality bed and lovely linen. The breakfast was great beautiful cheese, yoghurt, bread and fruits complimented by fresh pastries and superb coffee. The reception and concierge staff were friendly, knowledgeable and anything one requested was carried out with a minimum of fuss and always to our satisfaction. The decor is outstanding it's deco without being ugly, even if you are not a fan of deco you will love what they have done here. I will return, it was a home away from home, pure class. It's a million miles away from the Palazzo Manfredi, where the rooms are nice but the staff are very poor. We thought the Lord Byron represented great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, very nice”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: Rome is a busy city, so it was nice to have such peace. But, it's a bit far to walk to most attractions. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, clean, and beautiful there. Decent room size. I like cushy beds and pillows and I didn't find theirs comfy. But, I had that complaint about the other 3 hotels I stayed at, so maybe it's just Italian style. Restaurant was decent. Lounge was cozy. I was unable to sign into wifi with my blackberry phone.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel in quiet location within walking distance of Pincio and Via Veneto.”
Reviews.Author: kd100_10
Reviews.Content: For many years the Lord Byron has been our preferred stay in Rome and it continues to get better and better. Sumptuous art deco interior and a collection of stunning furniture from this era, but the most impressive feature of the hotel lies with the level of welcoming and efficient service provided by the staff in all departments. Our room was spacious and elegant - perfect for settling down in a comfortable environment. The hotel has a new chef this year. He provides an interesting menu of well presented Italian dishes in the elegant restaurant. Breakfast, included in the room price, is a superior buffet one. Water and soft drinks are provided in room mini bars, as is WiFi. The hotel owner, Sig. Ottaviani is a hands-on owner/manager who is proud of his hotel - it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish art deco hotel - v impressed!”
Reviews.Author: keitharrowsmith
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something a little different - a true Boutique small hotel - or a fan of the art deco period - consider this hotel. Its a small establishment - in a quiet district of Rome - north of the Spanish Steps - a pleasant 15 minute stroll through a park. Helpful staff speak (at least) English as well as Italian, and arranged an airport transfer, restaurant recommendations and reservations, taxis, car hire, and a birthday cake - all without fuss. Room was a good size, with marble bathroom. Spotlessly clean, with complimentary soft drinks and water (replaced twice a day) and free wifi. Other hotels take note! We had great breakfasts and an evening meal at the hotel - all charming. It's a quiet hotel, in a quiet neighbourhood - and if the walk through the park doesn't appeal, then most of the sites are a short taxi ride away. You are the right side of town for the new concert venue (Auditorium) and stadium too. Our room suffered a little from plumbing noises, and a few mornings the staff were busy cleaning and repairing before 9am, but minor issues. The hotel doesn't have much outdoor space - a quiet drink in the gardens would have been a perfect end to hot days - but the bar at the Modern Art museum is 5 mins away!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best run hotel in the world - the owner should give lessons”
Reviews.Author: HMamiye
Reviews.Content: Had the priviledge of spending 5 nights with my family at this property. We took 3 rooms all of which were unique and well appointed. While it is a beautiful building in a great location (adjacent to Borghese Park in a very upscale quiet residential neighborhood of Rome) - the most memorable aspect was the impecable service. Under the ever watchful eye of the owners , the entire staff from the bellman , the front desk staff , waiters , housekeeping , etc - were probably the best and most accommodating I've ever experienced. The owner should give lessons to the luxury hotel chains on how to properly run a hotel ! Free breakfast , minibar and wifi were all greatly appreciated amenities.

Reviews.Title: “not for me”
Reviews.Author: ssn12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here way back in January 2008. It was my first time trying out a boutique hotel of this sort, and although it was very charming, it put me off the whole boutique hotel experience. The rooms were TINY, the television was from the days of my grandfather, the walls were paper thin, room service was a joke, and the bathroom door wasn't even a door- it was some sliding thing that didn't close properly (did I mention the bathroom was also tiny?) But as I said, the hotel is charming. I liked its location, I enjoyed just going for a stroll with my husband (then boyfriend) and exploring the areas around. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice, and we enjoyed a romantic meal there. The staff were all very nice and helpful. Other travelers may like it here, but this was certainly not the place for me.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel AND WOULD DEFINETLY GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: saribyocean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The amenities were superb. Service wasexcellent.

Reviews.Title: “A experience worth repeating!”
Reviews.Author: chipsargent
Reviews.Content: After 3 nonstop days in Paris with our children, it was nice to slow down and enjoy a bit that Rome has to offer. My wife researched our accommodations, and we all agreed the Hotel Lord Byron far exceeded our expectations. The friendliness of the staff upon our arrival, the actual room accommodations, and it's location within the city made our stay that much more relaxing. One point worth mentioning, is to not miss enjoying one evening dining within the hotel, as the atmosphere, food, and service were second to none. Overall, a very nice hotel quietly located in a very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Art Deco Hotel. Shame about the food and its prices.”
Reviews.Author: kfandeaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be one of the most luxurious small hotels in the world, never mind Rome, surpassing the Savoy in London and the Waldorf in New York where we have previously stayed. The location is a quiet with gardens nearby, yet a short taxi ride from the tourist and shopping areas. Both the public areas and the bedroom we had were impeccably furnished and prepared, and every member of staff we encountered made us feel personally welcome, and wanted to help make our stay memorable, which it was. Royalty would feel at home here.....................EXCEPT...................... for the food. Breakfast was the standard help yourself buffet. Our one dinner was the worst hotel meal we've had in 50 years of travelling. As our main course we selected baked lamb described as a traditional dish prepared with potatoes, herbs and vegetables. What came were 4 tough as boots chops obviously grilled on a griddle (you could see the stripes) with a dollop of spinach and a few asparagus shoots, swimming in the water the spinach had been boiled in but not properly drained. Our complaint regarding the absence of potatoes resulted in the arrival of 2 small spuds which had been hastily sliced and fried! Flamboyantly described desert turned out to be ice cream with pieces of croissant. Wine by the glass was charged @ 9 Euros for a 120 ml measure, an indication of how outrageously expensive the meal was for what was provided. So. We recommend you stay here, but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Traveller007_11
Reviews.Content: Great Service...clean and accomodating. We stayed here for 3 nights. About 20 minutes walk away from central sites but in a nice boutique part of Rome near National theatre. A little pricey but if you want piece of mind especially with kids it is fantastic. Knowlegable staff and great restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Very special”
Reviews.Author: GuillermoAngel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a two-day Rome stop before the flight home. The hotel is lovely and the service is impeccable. Parioli is quiet and attractive. I'm not sure I would recommend the neighborhood to a first timer in Rome, but for me Parioli will be the choice from here on out. Whether it's the long walk through the Borghese or a cab ride, getting there is a pleasure. Once you arrive, there's a pleasant neighborhood feel and some good restaurants. One of us met the owners, Mr. and Mrs. Ottaviani, in the lounge. They were welcoming and gracious and took the time to show and explain the hotel's art collection. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Hotel Lord Byron!”
Reviews.Author: LovingItaly51
Reviews.Content: In the hustle bustle of Rome, it was very nice to escape it and stay at the beautiful boutique Hotel Lord Byron. Situated in an upscale residental area of the Borgese Gardens, walking through the Gardens daily gave us an opportunity to walk off the food and wine we consumed in Rome. The Hotel's food & service was first class, 5 stars. The hotel has 32 rooms, and unless we went to breakfast, we didn't know anyone else was staying there. If you love privacy, special service & food, you will love The Hotel Lord Bryon!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home is always the same!”
Reviews.Author: Fraschillo
Reviews.Content: A colleague of mine and I were again in Rome in May and as usual stayed at the Lord Byron. We also had been to Florence prior to arriving in Rome and stayed at the Lord Byron's sister hotel, The Regency. Both were, as always, "incredible" places. My wife and I are returning to Rome in July and will of course stay at the Lord Byron. I am always welcomed and made to feel as if the hotel is truly my home. I recommend Mr. Ottaviani's establishments to all of my colleagues in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation, overpriced, poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: Eye4Detail081
Reviews.Content: This probably was a great hotel about 10 years ago but the room decor was faded with sloppy make do renovations. Cleanliness was not great - upon checking into our room we found dirty tissues underneath the sink. coffee stains on the crockery. Spending close to 400 Euros a night we would also have expected at least movies on demand/ some English language channels/ fitness facilities - but nothing! If you want to explore city centre Rome don't stay here it is at least a 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps which is not an easy or direct route.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Zozotravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is shabby and without ambience. We were told we had a "lovely room" with a balcony; the room was typically small and very basic for a 5 star hotel and the balcony view looked right onto construction and scaffolding. The best part of this hotel were the breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, service, service.”
Reviews.Author: StephenD708
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but after our stay I felt it was necessary. This hotel is not only beautiful but you can feel that the owner and staff treat the property and its guests as if it was their own home you were staying at. You feel like you are in a residence not a hotel. The staff helpful and polite, always attentive. High value, quiet neighborhood. Only complaint was that we are now spoiled and expect other hotels to be as beautiful, friendly and warm. Steve and Ella

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SSIHome
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a week long visit to Rome (late April/earlyMay) to celebrate her birthday. In selecting hotels, I settled on the Lord Byron based on my own research and the reviews to be found on-line. Let me add that we are both well-traveled and have experienced our share of hotel disappointments. In a sentence, the Lord Byron and its staff was a wonderful find! From the moment we arrived, the staff made sure our every comfort was met and this despite a minor check-in problem due to another departing guest. In fact, the most appealing aspect of this charming hotel is its wonderful staff- I have to singularly point out Marta, Gus, the other gentleman concierge/front desk (whose name I did not get- apologies) and of course, the incomparable Andrea Lacetera. An entire review could be written regarding the services and attention provided by Andrea and those who have written before me have echoed the accolades afforded this fine gentleman. Andrea assisted me in planning many aspects of my itinerary as there were certain special touches I desired in order to make the visit a memorable birthday for my wife. His every suggestion and attention to detail was impeccable. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood on the north of the Borghese Park. The location makes for an exceedlingly quiet stay and a true oasis after a hectic and noisy day/evening in the crowds of Rome. We are accustomed to walking and frankly enjoyed our strolls through the park as we came and went. A taxi is but a 1 minute wait when needed. Marta is happy to map out the shortcuts through the park if walking is preferred. The interior is art-decco modern and a clear departure from chain hotels, as well as from the opulent over-upholstered interiors of other area hotels. The public areas are tastefully charming and our room, with a view and small balcony on the front, was exactly what we expected (and needed). The room was quite spacious and cooled/heated to our needs. Mini bar drinks (water, colas) are freely available and included in the room cost but my suggestion is to visit Gus in the downstairs bar for a quick chat and glass of wine. Except for breakfast, we did not dine in the hotel- and again thanks to Andrea- we were ushered to many of Rome's finer restaurants (and by all means take him up on his suggestions to eat in some of the nearby restaurants that are typically not visited by tourists). With only a small number of rooms (32?), guests have immediate access to hotel staff for questions, planning, etc. In addition, one rarely sees other guests (this despite being nearly full) and the entire feel is almost like staying in someone's villa. Already we are discussing a return visit and look forward to seeing our friends at the Lord Byron once again. This was the perfect hotel visit for us and we can't imagine staying anywhere else in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with the friendliest staff in Italy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaG-77
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough nice things about this lovely hotel in Rome! From the moment we arrived Andreas (spelling?) and the rest of the staff were so welcoming and friendly! we hope to visit again someday soon and stay with them again! Grazie!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Polina28
Reviews.Content: It was the firs time in my life when I relied on trip advisor reviews and was so much disappointed that I had to change hotel I can't understand how people could rate this hotel as excellent. The hotel needs renovation, it seems like the owner is so keen of the history of his hotel since 1960s that he does't want to refurbish and renovate the rooms. But they are so old that I had allergy every time when I got in to room. So I would pay for it max 100 euro, not 350-500 as they want for it. The service yes it was immediate and professional, this was the only positive thing, but all the rest was very strange, no complimentary bathing amenities, complimentary breakfast included only jams, bread and pastry, all other things like omlette or eggs were a la carte and not cheap. So it was a bad experience and I won' t rate this hotel as 5 star or recommend it to my friends. May be older people would like this hotel willing to get back to 70s atmosphere, but for young people who are used to pay for luxury hotels and get luxury for their money this is not the right place.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in every regard.”
Reviews.Author: DavidR69
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron Hotel is an excellent hotel. My wife and I stayed for a week during April so that we could have a look around Rome. We received excellent service from all the staff throughout our stay. In particular, the concierge team were knowledgeable, very helpful and 'made things happen'. They seemed to have the knack of being able to anticipate our needs. The restaurants that were recommended were exactly what we were looking for and were also of very high standard. When I asked for tickets to see Lazio play (I asked on Sunday morning for the game the same day!) - they were naturally doubtful but delivered nonetheless. Brilliant ! The hotel is decorated in an art deco style, including the bedrooms. This makes the experience much more interesting than the usual bland/functional style adopted by the large chains. The overall feel is one of calm and relaxation in, what can be, a very busy and energetic city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not suited for young children”
Reviews.Author: Jardinier2011
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a long weekend in Rome and we stayed at the Lord Byron in a suite. I travel a lot for work and leisure and I have never posted on Trip Advisor because our trips usually are great. However, I felt that it was necessary to post our experience at this hotel so that other families with young children are aware of it. After reading the great reviews of this 5 star, we were excited about the trip. When I booked the room in December, I communicated in writing that I would need 2 baby cribs. A week before our arrival, I wrote to the hotel to reconfirm and the resident manager told me that a crib or a rollaway would be an option for our older child. I explicitly told her that I wanted 2 cribs. She said fine. When we arrived, I was told that only one crib was available. I informed the front desk that this was not acceptable given my original communication and my correspondence with the manager last week. We went up to the suite and found that the hotel had already pulled out the couch and made it up as a bed. This irritated me even more. Forty-five minutes later, the front desk called me and said that they had another crib. When the crib arrived, I was not impressed. It looked like a small wooden crate with bars around it with a mattress as thick as a sponge. This is not 5 star service. To put things into perspective, the Four Seasons has beautiful brass cribs decorated with colorful buntings, beautiful bed linens, a stuffed animal and a welcome gift for children. Later at breakfast, we were told that there was only 1 high chair in the restaurant. I could not believe it. The poor other family with a young child had no high chair to use at all. Some of the other reviewers wrote about how it was lovely to walk through the park to get to the city sites. This is true if you don't have a stroller with 25 kilos of kids in them. The hotel is situated on top of a hill. To get to the sites, one must walk down a big hill, then walk up a big hill and then down again and then of course, up, down, up on the way back. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to the closest site, about 1.5 hours to get to the Colosseum. We like to walk a lot but it is hard to avoid taking cab at all if you stay at this hotel. Again, if you don't have young children, that is fine. If you do and have to drive without car seats in a taxi, it's not exactly safe. My advice to the hotel is to invest in some basic baby equipment: comfortable cribs and more high chairs if you want to accommodate families with young children. Families with young children may want to stay closer to the center to avoid the long hilly walk to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a genuine feeling of luxury.”
Reviews.Author: kristinm25
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome on March 31st and stayed six nights at the Lord Byron Hotel with our children and parents. The staff speeks excellent English and I was very satisfied with our choice of hotel. The rooms are elegant, quite large and cleaned every time you leave your key at the reception. The concierge service was polite, efficient and helpful with all our requests, such as providing a babysitter, hairdresser, wedding bouquet, restaurant recommandations etc. Genuine hospitality and friendlyness seems to be their trademark.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KKent
Reviews.Content: If you like smaller hotels (32 rooms) you will like this one. Very good staff, reasonable cost, and good food as well. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryna_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband at the beginning of March. The location of the hotel was excellent, in a quiet and green place. The rooms were cosy and it felt more like visiting a friend than staying in a hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helped us to make the most of our visit to Rome with helpful advice and help with booking museum tickets etc. I would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid tranquility, service, comfort and professionalism”
Reviews.Author: Midge13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lord Byron for a long weekend and were delighted in all aspects of this beautifully furnished and managed hotel. Although a short walk from the centre of Rome the bonus is that you can walk through the Borghese Park to get there - an added bonus as the park was beautiful. From the time we arived until we left all of the staff were nothing but friendly, polite and extremely helpful Service was quietly efficient but totally unassuming and the decor was beautiful and reflected the luxury of the hotel. We loved the wardrobes in the bedroom - you must go there to witness them and the bedroom was kept spotlessly clean and serviced throughout the day. If I had any "complaint" with a very small "c" it would be the lack ot tea and coffee making facilities in the bedroom. Although we didn't dine in tthe hotel braekfast was superb and as with everything with this hotel nothing was too much trouble. We will certainly return if we come back to Rome or we will use their partner hotel in Florence. Another good choice thanks to Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Place”
Reviews.Author: LulyS65
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, position, room and service was really nice

Reviews.Title: “High quality art-deco boutique hotel close to tourist centre.”
Reviews.Author: rupertm75
Reviews.Content: Staff were excellent, room was decent with shutters outside the window - we had a great night's sleep. Cleaners tidied the room every time we went out, left slippers - there's a lot of attention to detail to make your stay better. They even gave us a bottle of champagne when they knew it was our anniversary. Parking outside. Breakfast buffet ok, but a bit light on choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: leisuregirl046
Reviews.Content: I feel badly taking so long to write our review of the Lord Byron but better late than never. We stayed at the Lord Byron for 5 nights in November and it was an absolutely wonderful stay. We stayed in the penthouse suite with a fabulous terrace and we could not have been happier. The service was fabulous. Andrea the head concierge was so wonderful, he even managed to get us a reservation at the best restaurant in Rome when I was not able to secure one months in advance! He arranged a fabulous private tour of the Vatican on short notice. Our every wish was granted. The hotel, granted was a little our of the way but I must say it was such a wonderful relief to get away from all the hustle and bustle of Rome at the end of the day. Also there wonderful barman Nicolas was so accomodating.....best Kir Royals ever. Would I stay ther again....in a heartbeat. Loved the Lory Byron.

Reviews.Title: “An Art Deco delight - unassumingly elegant with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Nijinsky53
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a recent visit to Rome with my Italian husband. My husband is an ex hotelier / restauranteur & like many who understand the trade, is difficult to please. This hotel exceeded expectation on all levels, from the quiet friendliness of the staff, to the lovely period furnishings & decor. The hotel is not in the City Centre - but this was not a problem to us - but an advantage - as it was a quiet (& most civilized) retreat after a busy day exploring. The City is a short cab ride away through the Villa Borghese, and wherever you pick to stay, there is always a trip to some of the sights of this massive City. Our room was always clean, and there was a turn down service every evening - but we never saw the housekeeping staff at all & were never disturbed. The owners of this hotel actually live here & there was much evidence of the continuing care & attention of the proprietors throughout. The restaurant (Sapori) is excellent by any standards - service is personal and of a type so rarely found these days. All in all an excellent small hotel which I would have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay - a great find!”
Reviews.Author: lferguson1
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. While it was a short walk from all the historical sites, my partner and I didn't mind at all. We could come back to our room after an exhausting day and enjoy the quiet luxury of The Lord Byron. Our room's bathtub was enormous - yay! - the bed was super comfortable, and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating and friendly. We especially enjoyed the automatic shade, which completely blackened the room and helped us get over that jet lag much more quickly. I encourage you to explore restaurants in this neighborhood - they were far superior to the touristy joints in the historic center. And less expensive, believe it or not!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant oasis of calm, with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: KiriO
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome to celebrate my husband's birthday, and we wanted a special hotel. Lord Byron Hotel is everything we could have hoped for - it is small, stylish, quiet, and the service is outstanding. The breakfast was delicious with a larger selection than usual in European hotels, and beautifully presented. Our room was spotless and it had a wrap-around balcony. It was completely quiet - you can truly rest here. The common area, or salon, is relaxing and inviting if you want to sit and read, or have a drink. Most of all, we can not compliment enough the concierge, Mr. Andrea Lacetera. He is a treasure! Andrea greets you every day with a smile and there is nothing he wants more than for you to be happy at his hotel! He assisted us with several reservations and everything was seamless. Thank you for a wonderful stay - we would surely go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TombRaider55
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The staff could not have been any more helpful. The hotel is clean, attentive, and reasonably priced. In fact, it was one of the few high points on my recent trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to enjoy Rome without the crowds and noise”
Reviews.Author: eztraveller72
Reviews.Content: Tired as we were of overpriced hotels with tiny rooms and dubious air conditioners that - no matter how noisy - could not mask the noisy streets outside, on this trip to Rome we selected the Lord Byron, and could not have made a better choice. With the Borghese grounds separating us from the Piazza Populo and other tourist haunts, this delightful quiet hotel is 20 quiet minutes' walk from the bustling heart of the City. Our Superior Room, although not large, was more than adequate, was very nicely appointed and warmed with interesting art-deco designs. And so quiet! The hotel staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. On our first day my wife defeated any risk of jet lag by sleeping in until 11:00 a.m., well past the closing of the breakfast room. No worries. The bar steward provided her with coffee and rolls in the bar once she surfaced! The staff gave us good suggesrtions for local dining, and I would particularly recommend the Ristaurante Ambasciata d'Abruz, a short 10-minute walk from the hotel. Our only "hiccup" on the stay was that we arranged for pick-up by hotel car on our arrivgal at the airport. When a car finally arrived thanks to some persistent calling by a helpful competitor, the driver had difficulty finding the hotel despite our providing address and general direction. If the first step of the visit was thus not perfect, I hasten to add that everything thereafter was.

Reviews.Title: “"WONDERFUL OWNERSHIP & EMPLOYEES, GOOD LOCATION AND PRICE, VERY NICE ROOMS AND THE FOOD IS FABULOUS"”
Reviews.Author: billdgolf
Reviews.Content: A charming Botique Hotel away from the maddening crowds. In a quiet neighborhood. We were a party of 18 and we were handled efficiently. The owner was on the site and made sure everyone was satisfied. All the employees were very nice ie: Desk people, maids and waiters etc, etc. The food was fabulous, breakfast was superb. A five star Hotel with a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Lazorbeam
Reviews.Content: We loved our week at the Lord Byron. Our first trip to Rome. At first we thought we were a bit too far from things, but after the first day we knew that wasn't the case. The staff was very helpful and the room was lovely. We had a little veranda where we could sit at night and relax. We walked through the Borghese gardens on our way to several attractions and it was just beautiful. There was also a bus stop right at the bottom of the street. Our long awaited trip to Italy was everthing we expected and more. Many thanks to the staff at Lord Byron. Hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem, ready to return!”
Reviews.Author: Ctmom90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love finding smaller, boutique hotels when we travel and the Hotel Lord Byron turned out to be exactly what we were looking for. What a charming and beautiful hotel this is. Tucked away at the northern end of the Villa Borghese in a very upscale part of town, the Hotel Lord Byron provided 5 star service, plush and spacious room (with terrace and view!) and delicious breakfast every morning. We liked that it was a bit off the beaten path, which made it wonderfully quiet at night. We were only a short taxi ride from anywhere "touristy" we wanted to go. We advised the hotel we were celebrating our anniversary and they surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne. The concierge Andrea could not have been more helpful, steering us to a local restaurant, Pagaroma, that we were able to walk to one evening for a delicious meal. He also advised us on arranging a local tour guide to see some classic Roman sights (a bit pricey but still good). The desk staff was courteous and helpful and Andrea (different man) even made phone calls to Alitalia to inquire, in Italian, about our upcoming flights to the Puglia region. The bathroom was spacious (huge tub) and the hotel provided excellent products for our use. This is a hotel we will tell our friends about. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: egbok
Reviews.Content: This is the only review I have ever written. My expectations of services I receive while traveling are of the highest standards; therefore, I never feel the need to write reviews ... Lord Byron proves the exception. The period of Art Deco has always had an allure for me. It represents high artistic style and an era of grandeur. Lord Byron unfolds its world at the entrance; as if a page of history comes to life. Without waxing on, there is no expense spared by our hotelier, Amedeo Ottavian, in bringing to life the best of the art deco period. With a gracious staff, enjoy your stay; it is incomparable, personalized and professional. Ciao, Neal and Eileen

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to be”
Reviews.Author: travelet
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire week in Rome Lord Byron was our home base. All I can say is we loved this hotel. Very classy and elegant. Its friendly and helpful staff were soon like part of the family for us, especially the hotel owner. He puts an effort into making his guests feel welcome. THANK YOU for that! The hotel is located in Parioli, a quiet residential/embassy district, within walking distance the Villa Borghese. Several of Rome's best restaurants can also be reached on foot, but the Lord Byron hotel is famous for its own restaurant, the Sapori. I personally enjoyed the location because it was a safe area to walk around in, not too touristy, but still within easy reach to the city center. I cant wait to get back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kd100_10
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron has been our favoured base for many years whenever we are in Rome. As a small, owner-managed luxury hotel it offers a peaceful location close to the Borghese gardens in a leafy residential area. The many attractions of Rome can be accessed via a fifteen - minute walk across the park to Pincio, Trinita dei Monti or Via Veneto, or by taking a short taxi ride to the monuments of Ancient Rome such as the Forum, Colosseo, Pantheon etc. The hotel is a large, white villa offering quiet and comfort in a city famous for its noise and bustle. It is furnished sumptuously in Art Deco style. Our superior double room provided space and style and a useful terrace for outdoor relaxation. The service from staff is impeccable, with no weak links. Staff seem to take a personal interest in guests and are friendly and helpful rather than cold and formal. The housekeeping service is particularly impressive. Breakfast, served in the restaurant, is a generous buffet. The restaurant, once the best in Rome, now provides meals for guests in the bar, simple but elegantly served.

Reviews.Title: “AFTER A LONG FLIGHT TO ROME, THIS WAS AN EXCEPTIONAL PLACE TO STAY FOR THE BEGINNING OF OUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: bktsm1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exceptionally clean, beautiful decor, the staff was terrific and the owner was a pleasure to meet. I ahve been to many hotels around the world and this hotel ranks tight up there in my book.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel in every possible way”
Reviews.Author: inikamozi
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights in this beautiful hotel. In art deco style, this hotel is immaculate, very clean, well cared for and very homely. Situated on the edge of the Villa Borghese, the central part of town, from the Tridente is a comfortable walk away, around 15 minutes through the park. The beautiful modern art gallery - Galleria Nazionale d'arte Moderrna is only a few minues from the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel, included in the price was faultless. The staff in the hotel were all amazing, very very friendly, always helpful and made every minute of our stay in the hotel just fantastic. We used the hotel as a base for visits to the city, so not sure if the Lord Byron had a pool, but as we don't swim - not important. The hotel is relaxing and quiet and met our needs entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the steep room price.”
Reviews.Author: RGoodman9
Reviews.Content: A very impressive entrance to the Hotel, and a very nice and helpful concierge. Nice touch when we first arrived as they sent us up a bottle of preseco as it was our honeymoon. However, somewhat disappointed by the decor and overall feel of the room. We decided to splash out on this hotel as it was our honeymoon but really didn't feel it lived up to the 'luxury' and high price tag we were expecting. The decor felt jaded, as opposed to lavish. Breakfast was nice but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Elena2205_9
Reviews.Content: I was taken to this hotel by the girls for a special weekend birthday celebration, you are transported back in time and you feel as if you should be rich and famous such is the ambiance of this hotel, the rooms are all different and unique in there own charming way, breakfast was buffet style, but not buffet as we know it even this was done with a touch of elegance. A short taxi ride gets you to all the main tourist attractions and taxis were plentiful at the bottom of the road. If you have a special occasion to celebrate and you want to feel special this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl2008
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Lord Byron after a horrible experience at another hotel in the heart of Rome and we couldn't have been happier! The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the food was excellent, the staff was amazing, and this was a fantastic way to end our trip to Italy. Our room was spacious and beautiful. Yes, it is not located centrally, but it didn't take very long to get anywhere by taxi (for about 10-12 euros) and it was a peaceful haven to come back to after a long day sightseeing. The front desk staff was extremely helpful in arranging tours for us. The bartender was exceptional and we very much enjoyed our conversations with him. Everything in the hotel is done to perfection, including the beautiful art deco design, the art, and the service. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Paulwei
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are experienced worldwide travelers. We found this Hotel in Michelin and Leading Small Hotels of the World and it surpassed our expectations. The location is good and the service superb. Of particular note are the paintings and sculpture that the owner has placed througout the hotel and rooms. He apparntly has an extensive collection of such art, focusing exclusively on women. The concierges are particularly attentive to all requests and were able to acquire hard to get museum and similar tickets for admission and access to the fasttrack lines. We also stayed at the sister hotel, The Regency, in Florence and had a similary excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is even better than before”
Reviews.Author: Usna55
Reviews.Content: Our entire family of 10 stayed two nights here and we can't say enough good things about the architecture, the art, the owner, the food, the staff, the rooms. An example of an owner-designed, decorated, and managed luxury hotel in a quiet suburb of Rome just outside the city gates and near the Borghese Gardens and Museum. This one is not to be missed if you have an aesthetic sense and its price is not unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Sweety9London
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night around midnight,after our flight was diverted to Rome because of the volcanic ash crisis. We were hungry and tired and luckily the hotel had a room. On arrival, they told us that the kitchens were closed but the charming and sweet doorman told us he would arrange for some food to be brought up to our room. And only 10-15 minutes later, delightful tea and cheese sandwiches were brought up on a silver platter. What more could you ask for?! Throughout our stay, the reception were extremely helpful. The rooms were magnificent, very romantic. Breakfast was a dream and I honestly cannot say one bad thing about this hotel! Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, classy elegance”
Reviews.Author: oldenoughtoknow
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron is a hotel you will remember forever. The rooms are luxurious and large, with balconies overlooking the Borghese Gardens. The neighborhood is quiet and elegant, more residential than city. Many museums are withing walking distance, the Modern and Etruscan are virtually around the corner, while the Borghese Gallery, considered by many to be among the best, is a lovely 20-minute walk through the Borghese Gardens. The hotel has an excellent restaurant serving lunch and dinner, with an adjacent, fantastic wine bar, and is also used to serve the exceptional daily breakfast. Luxury amenities are abundant and graciously provided, including turndown service. Best of all is the service. Because of the hotel's small size, the concierge, who is absolutely excellent in every respect, is never pressed to rush you, and in our case recommended an excellent guide for both the Borghese and the Vatican Museum, as well as several very good restaurants within walking distance. Most memorable however, was the ubiquitous presence of the owners, who sat across from us at dinner our first night and greeted us daily thereafter with genuine warmth, as one would greet honored guests. It's a bit of a walk, but doable, to the nearest sights, such as the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto, but the Piazza Populo, where there is a Metro stop, is about 15 minutes through the park. A cab stand however is only down the block, and a cab will be at the hotel if called in less than a minute. In sum, a luxurious, romantic, and charming stay.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jetprincess01
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! Service at it's best. It was a perfect stay by the Spanish Steps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful , elegant stay!”
Reviews.Author: elizabar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six day trip to Rome with my husband and loved our stay at The Lord Byron! The hotel is a beautiful five story art deco mansion with magnificently decorated public spaces (lobby, bar/lounge and restaurant) and an elevator. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a small balcony facing the front of the hotel (#306). It was also beautifully decorated but felt a bit tired (some chipped furniture and tears in the wallpaper), however, it was spacious and very clean. The hotel has very thick glass on the windows as well as mechanical metal shades to keep your room dark and extremely quiet. The pillows are somewhat firm however, we found the bed and pillows perfect for us and slept very well. The bathroom was also a good size with both a tub and shower combination with great water pressure. Nice bath products provided also. Breakfast in the restaurant was beautiful and delicious - great choices each morning and the best cappuccino made by Fabrizio! The staff is wonderful - very gracious, friendly and very informative regarding getting around the city and recommendations for dinners. The only negative comment we have is that the location was farther away than expected. The hotel is in a very beautiful, residential, quiet and safe neighborhood, however, it is about 20-30 minutes away from the center of Rome on foot. You don't want to start your day tired and at the end of each day of wandering the city you are quite tired and we had to take taxis. There are some good local restaurants (Blokk was delicious!) but you can't just wander out of the hotel and find a gem as you can in Trastevere. Overall, the Lord Byron Hotel was a wonderful, elegant stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but.....”
Reviews.Author: Bruce095
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron is a great little hotel - we were on the top floor with a view across the roof tops - no roof tops of note but a view nonetheless. The staff without exception were excellent - without a doubt made the breakfast times special with their smiles and attention to detail. Breakfasts could not faulted and when you realise the prices of food in the city centre - makes you appreciate even more! Do not stay at this hotel if you want to be in amongst the action. The location made us switch priorities furing our five nights ie had long days and then relaxing evenings back at the hotel. If you want to have the day and then back into town in the evening it will mean taxis. For us the morning walk through the park to the over look was one of the highlights of the day - just depends what your priorities are. Negatives:- no work station to do airline check in. 'You can hire a lap top' - really after the price we have just paid for the room. Not a good last impression. The reception suggested restaurant around the corner (loose phrase) Ambasciata d'brutto - the rudest most arrogant waiter we have had the misfortune of coming across. Soon as he realised we weren't going to have five courses and two bottles of wine we obviously took on the appearance of something he had trodden in. Presmably becasue he saw his tip shrinking - well he got that bit right. The tip instead goes to hotel:- be sure of what you recommend - as it reflects on you. Finally - hotel pillows ........all I can say is just do not have a pillow fight - hit the wall by mistake and you will take out the building.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but a bit far from centre”
Reviews.Author: RolandShanghai
Reviews.Content: we had booked Lord Byron well in advance - prepaid at Euro 200 per night - for a couple days for our honeymoon. well, first some comments about Italy. I have been there many times and also speak some Italian; but I've never been in the South (we continued all the way down to Sicily); one thing is sure, you gotta check every bill or return money; there is a 50% chance they'll try to cheat on you. first was taxi driver from airport; he simply "accepted" the 50 euro bill, although official charge is 40 euro. we then had quite some funny meal bills; quite often a "rounded" sum, no discussion... funny was also the service man at a petrol station near Naples. I made the mistake to pay with a 500 euro note for 33,75 worth of gasoline; he picked out some coins from my wife wallets and then disappeared for a few minutes. he then handed me back 460 euro and said in a very convincing voice that I still owe him 7 euro... well, I wasn't that stupid. when you are in hotels and order something in the restaurant or bar and they "put it simply on the room bill", watch out; mostly they put something more expensive; on Amalfi coast (see separate report for Tritone hotel in Praiano) they charged us 60 euro for a 40 euro meal, and another bottle of wine...; so make sure you always ask for bill and sign it! don't trust their smile! anyway, meals in Italy with their antipasto/primo/secondi fashion, are really expensive; we also were quite unlucky as we had very little good food - although we traveled with guide Michelin and were in plenty fancy restaurants; and what about not putting side dishes with their secondi, respectively charging 10 euro for some overgrilled veggie??? it seems they only got grilled veggies and french fries anyway; they got so many veggies growing in Italy, why not sell them in restaurants? Lord Byron: they got us a room on the first floor (reception is on 3rd floor); no view whatsoever and very funny colourful decoration; but what you want for 200 euro anyway? it was quiet though; breakfast is mediocre. hotel is quite far from city, no way to walk - you'd get completely lost anyway. so you always have to take taxis - don't worry about tipping, the drivers do that for themselves anway...; one good thing is Andrea - the concierge; very helpful. we actually ran into a very stupid problem. we had booked a Mercedes E-class via Europcar; well, you want to rent a high class car in Italy, you gotta have minimum two credit cards, one minimum gold or platinum; well, I didn't have all cards on me, so I was not allowed to rent a car!!! Andrea got us then a car from the boss of Hertz. took us an entire day to fix that! we had one excellent dinner at Mirabelle restaurant - Michelin star rated - with amazing view; well, in Rome that is pricey though; any dish is in the 50 euro area; so be prepared to spend well above 500 euro! Rome is very nice, but not as big as one would think. by the way, you do not need a guide for the Vatican, save those 200 euro...

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home is as wonderful as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Fraschillo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lord Byron has been my home away from home in Rome for many years. The staff are more like friends and family than hotel personnel. Such was the case once again on a recent trip in April. I felt it absolutely necessary to write another review simply to state that while the world-wide economic downturn has been difficult for all hotels internationally and has affected service in many, the Lord Byron's superb service has remained the same. It has not wavered in the least. My wife accompanied me on this trip and as always was made to feel as if the hotel was hers. If you have not tried the Lord Byron, you must!! It too will be your home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lilsapito
Reviews.Content: the staff were great, very attentive and kind, the hotel in itself was great. I would suggest it for couples or for a single person who just wants peace, quiet and comfort while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ropavieja
Reviews.Content: The boutique hotel was just fantastic. The room was great -- clean, comfortable and big (based on what I had expected from Rome hotels), deserving its branding as a five-star hotel. Didn't try the restaurant except for the breakfast, where the staff were warm and friendly. The best of all was the front desk. They helped me call for a cab because the location isn't close to the main street. I left my wallet in the taxi -- and guess what --Andrea at the front desk helped me locate the cab driver and I got it back!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: Carmo_Brasil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at new year`s eve. It is a wonderful hotel, the staff is marvelous and restaurant is perfect . We felt at home. Housekeeping is very efficient, turn down service is done 2 times per day. Concierge is very helpful. It is a little far from attractions but neighborhood is very calm. Restaurant was flawless, good breakfast and dinner was superb. Certainly we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharpei831
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were relieved when we arrived at the Hotel Lord Byron and saw what a great hotel we had picked. We arrived early, and they graciously allowed us to check in early so we could freshen up before hitting the streets of Rome. We booked a standard room, which was somewhat small, but not too bad. The bed was somewhat hard, as a few reviewers mentioned, but we barely noticed, as we were so tired after touring Rome, that it was easy to fall asleep. The location is about a 30-45 minute walk from many of Rome's attractions, but we enjoy walking and felt like we needed the extra exercise. The hotel itself is beautiful, and the service was definitely above any hotel I have ever stayed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay slightly out of the way of Rome's main streets. We chose this hotel after much research and were very happy with our decision!

Reviews.Title: “A chic little boutique hotel that you won't be disappointed with....”
Reviews.Author: HermesgirlOrlando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Lord Byron...we can see why it's a "Small Leading Hotel"...the decor is fab...the staff were so kind, helpful and knowledgeable! I read reviews regarding the location prior to going and I have to say I'm confused...sure...you're not going to walk outside the front door of the hotel into the Spanish Steps but who cares? It's super easy to get anywhere from there and very close to the gorgeous Borghese Gallery...the only negative I can share and it's important ...is that our bed was basically two twin beds pushed together and a sheet put over it...there was a dip in the beds and the bedding was horrible...there really wasn't any bedding...a top sheet and the pillows were like a piece of cardboard and about as thick....but having said that again...gorgeous little hotel, amazing staff, super clean, great food and we loved the location! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Rome in front of Villa Borghese. Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequentlyaround
Reviews.Content: My enthusiasm about the Lord Byron is due to his escellent pricing policy. We paid just over 200 Euros for a wonderful spacious room with antique furnitures and marble bathroom. Breakfast was included. I was sceptical about the location but instead it is not at all fare from Via Veneto. You can walk there. Anyway I was surprised by the strong artistic personality of this small hotel. Amazing are the small library, the sitting room and the bar. Art is everywhere. So is calm and silence. I certainly will be back. This is a very theatrical small place and you are trated like a VIP even if you are not (we were wearing very odd clothes actually....) Give it a try. It is worth.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best small hotels in the City.”
Reviews.Author: JohnHoltCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This remarkable gem of a small hotel offers most anything one could want in a place to stay - good food ( breakfast included), quiet location and excellent service. Not one thing was amiss during a 9 day stay. This is a marvelous place to come back to and relax after enjoying the beauties of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: GrandOldMan
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Lord Byron in late Sept 2009. One of the nicest hotels we have ever encountered. Off the beaten path in Rome, but a beautiful walk across the park to all the sites, the hotel is a perfect oasis from all the tourists and rate race of Rome. From the marvelous staff to the nice size rooms, the hotel is what one should expect of a 5 star hotel. We have stayed in dozens of "5 star" properties throughout the world of which many were more hype than quality. Not the Lord Byron. It is 5 stars on all levels. You ask for it and you get it. They superb staff is waiting to help. They remember your name, take care of your needs and arrange for whatever you need. The breakfast in their excellent restaurant, included in the room rate, is beautiful, satisfying and tables are set enough apart for one to have an quiet and elegant meal. We will definitely go back to the Lord Byron on all future trips to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Lord Byron - Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkWalt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Byron for three days after returning from our cruise. The service, room, food an amenities were great. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and provided us a wealth of information about where to go, how to get there and where to eat. The only small issue is that the hotel is not near the center of town so you need to hop on a ten minute taxi ride to get there,

Reviews.Title: “it's slipping”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: This hotel has for decades been my preferred in Rome but it is slipping: for example, bathrooms are tired with chipped enamel and - because it is getting a bit run down and probably into a different market niche - it is not as clean as it used to be. There is a very good barman but the pianist was on holiday and the restauarant was not open for anyone other than the owner which does not give a "5 star" impression. Some of the staff are very friendly and helpful but in some quarters there is not quite enough charm/helpfulness for what is a small hotel. Mostly over the years, fellow guests have been quiet couples: this time breakfast was somewhat dominated by an exuberant Russian coach party. Perhaps the time is coming to turn what was a delightful place to stay back into the flats for which the building was originally constructed in 1939? It would be a lovely place to live.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best Hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: tittlebat
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron is situated just above Villa Borghese - a walk away form the City Centre. It is a fantastic Hotel - beautifully furnished, large bedrooms, great service, and the staff without exception are warm friendly, and extremely helpful. I had some shirts laundered - and they came back looking like I had just bought them. We had a really geat week there - ate in the restaurant a couple of times - where the food was first class - we are vegetarians- and had no difficulty choosing suitable dishes. The breakfasts too are superb. One tip I would give about Rome is to buy a really detailed street map - it will save hours - we got ourselves completey lost several times - because our map didn't have all the street names marked. We will definitely be retruning to The Lord Byron - it was one of the most , if not the most memorable holidays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Going2Mexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night here on the first and last night of our trip to Italy. It is on the other side of the Borghese Gardens from most of the city sites. On average we paid 6-12 Eur in cab fare depending on where we were going, time of day, and whether or not the cab driver knew the best way to go. We did get a great deal on the hotel, so the cab fare wasn’t a big deal to us. It would have been nice to stay right in the heart of the city. The rooms themselves were nice. The art deco look was neat, and the bathrooms were very spacious. My only complaint was that the beds were fairly hard, and the pillows were not great. I probably would look to stay somewhere closer to the attractions next time. I was fairly surprised this hotel was a member of “The Leading Hotels of the World” as I didn’t think it was THAT nice.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Hotel - Truly 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: bostontravelguy01880
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is entirely Art Deco. 5 stars doesn't even come close to describing this hotel. The hotel is situated in North Rome in a very residential area. It was exactly what we were looking for. We like to walk and this allowed us to really see the city. What a beautiful hotel. The room was amazing. The breakfast outstanding. Everything about this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: ChristianB
Reviews.Content: Rome is a noisy city but at the Lord Byron, guests can actually sleep with open windows without being bothered. The location was almost a bit too quiet for me, with very little to see or do in the immediate surroundings. The area is very upscale and residential and lacks cafes, shops, pharmacies etc. It is about a 15-20 min walk to Piazza Popolo and there is a taxi stand only 2 min from the entrance. The hotel itself is very pretty, with tasteful furniture that gives the hotel a 1930s ambiance. The staff is a bit formal, but very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious, beautiful and clean. The bathroom is very stylish but lacked a proper shower. The beds could have been more comfortable. Breakfast was included and was not too bad, but not comparable to a 5 star hotel or Northern European 4 star hotels. I would recommend the Lord Byron hotel to any Rome traveller given that the location is reasonably convenient for the purpose of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: famtraveller7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and pretty. Our room was small for a suite but, beautiful decorated with modern decor. The staff was courteous and helpful. The location was out of the ways and I am not sure if they had a shuttle service. We originally were not booked to stay here but, our original hotel over booked and sent us here. The hotel is non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: vemar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Lord Byron for 4 days as part of our Honeymoon, the wonderful staff on reception upgraded us to a Junior Suite and it was fantastic. The Lord Byron is situated on the edge of a beautiful park and a walk through the park will take you straight to the piazza de poppilo and the tube station, which can transport you around the city easily. The hotel restaurant was highly priced (you will find this the norm in Rome), but the food and service was excellent, and the wine served as it should be. We had a fantastic time here and no doubt we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Santctuary”
Reviews.Author: tillysuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Byron Hotel for a long weekend in May and couldn't really fault it. It is a little way out of the centre of Rome but well worth the 10 min taxi ride each day. (There is bus stop near by too). Quiet and peaceful - a little gem. We were given an upgrade to a suite on arrival. The room was an art deco beauty. Lovey bathroom with wonderful "goodies" and large towels which seems rare these days! The only criticism I would have was the bed was a little hard. Breakfast was included in the room tariff which made a huge difference; some hotels in Rome charge 40 euro per person for breakfast. It was a very good buffet breakfast - a great start to the day. The best thing about the hotel were the reception staff. They were SO helpful, and nothing was too much bother. They gave us excellent recommendations for dinner each night in different parts of the city. They also informed us of events happening in the city that we might otherwise have missed. If we go back to Rome we will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Glorious hotel. The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Terriwoo
Reviews.Content: Fabulous art deco, luxury hotel. Small and very stylish with excellent service. Rooms are beautifully appointed with great extras including bathrobes, slippers and lovely bathroom toiletries. Turndown service in the evening is always welcome. Lovely breakfast with plenty of fresh produce. We had one evening meal in the restaurant which was beautifully cooked and presented. Concierge will tell you all Rome's sights are within five minute taxi ride, which they probably are at 3am in the morning! It's such a busy city you will need to allow plenty of time to get there if you have booked tickets for a specific time. On the plus side, the taxi rank is at the bottom of the road and only takes a couple of minutes to get to the hotel. There is a decent restaurant within walking distance and several good quality pizzerias within a short taxi ride, all used by the locals which makes for a great atmosphere. All in all, if you are looking for a luxury break, in a quiet location the Lord Byron is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tp1970
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, cosy hotel. Very romantic, perfectly designed and very clean. I have visited lots of hotels - this one is an example of perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Little Precious Gem”
Reviews.Author: THECLEVERADVISOR
Reviews.Content: Execpt for overpriced room service a must in Rome. Perfect boutique hotel. Great bar, cozy room, excellent concierge. Great Breakfast. One of my favourite hotels in italy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb bliss”
Reviews.Author: Bibithegreat
Reviews.Content: A very peaceful hotel in a lovely area. Amazing service from the staff at this property: They are very kind, quick to smile or stop to chat a little and very discreet and polite. I have not seen better service in quite some time. Go!

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel”
Reviews.Author: emiana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice (for business) and both times were just perfect. The location is central, but quiet - just on the other side of Villa Borghese in the posh Parioli neighborhood. If you like to run in the morning, the park is perfect for that. Each time, the room was spacious, well appointed and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was huge. The bed is very comfortable and they have total blockout blinds for a very sound night's sleep (or afternoon nap!). The staff has always been very curteous, professional and very helpful, even when I've arrived quite late in the evening. Breakfast was good as was the internet connection. I even had some connection issues that were quickly resolved with a toll free phone call to the ISP. Overall, a great hotel to which I will keep returning.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a taxi ride!”
Reviews.Author: WesternSkies
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time online looking for the "right" hotel for our first trip to Rome. We looked at all the usual suspects but each time kept returning to the Lord Byron's website. We love small, unique and special hotels and this one fit the bill dead on! We arrived late in the evening but had no trouble settling in immediately. We had a suite on the top (6th) floor with a separate sitting room, bedroom and wonderful bathroom (Note: The elevator only goes to the 5th floor and a flight of steps is required to reach the top/6th floor). The Art Deco is really well done and fully integrated in every aspect of the hotel's design as well as its furnishings and decorations. Even though it was October, it was still pretty warm and we appreciated the AC units in the bedroom and sitting room.
