In the cool mornings we opened up the big windows to let in the cool air and take in the beautiful views from all sides. The bed was very comfortable, even for someone well over 6'. The bathroom was all white marble and we appreciated having 2 sinks, a separate bathtub (in the same room with the sinks) and shower (in a separate room with the toilet/bidet). The water pressure in the shower was a bit weak but the water was warm and the view from the shower over the rooftops outside made up for that! The public rooms/areas are all impecably kept and the staff is professional, courteous and helpful. The complementary breakfast was a welcome addition and, contrary to some of the reviews, we found it more than adquate to start the day! The neighborhood where the hotel is located is beautiful and being so near the beautiful Borgese gardens, made for some wonderful walks. If you're a dog lover, there's a dog park at the end of the gardens which was always great fun in the evenings. Logistically, as some of the reviews note, the hotel is a bit of a hike from the core tourist areas; however, in our view, that's a benefit since being able to retreat to the quiet, calm beauty of the hotel in the evenings was a welcome event. We walked a few times into the core area and enjoyed the scenery along the way; however, we also did end up using taxi's to take us to the core and back a few times as well. That said, the distance, by cab, is very short and the fare was never over 10 euros (usually less). Bottom line: If you want to be in the thick of things then you'll probably want to stay closer to the core. If you do, however, you'll miss this gem and the beauty that surrounds it. SPECIAL NOTICE goes to the incredible master barman in the hotel lounge! He really has style and makes the best negroni's I've ever had! We can't wait to return! P.S. To the hotel: Know all your guests and don't assume a room for 2 will always be occupied by a "Mr. and Mrs."

Reviews.Title: “A Heavenly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IngeborgHultenius
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I wanted to spend four days in Rome at the end of a cruise. Our travel agent selected the Lord Byron Hotel . . . and it was superb. It is located in a gorgeous residential district near Villa Borghese. From the moment we stepped out of our car to the day we left , the service was wonderful. The hotel is small (30 rooms, I believe) and you are not just a face. Everyone, from the porter to the concierge, to the waiters remembered our names and went out of their way to make this first trip to Rome memorable. The decor is Art Deco, at its best. Our room was to die for. Spacious, clean, beautifully decorated , all marble bathroom, and my favorite - a lovely, quiet , private stone patio with beautiful surrounding landscape. The restaurant was so nice that we ate most of our dinners there. There is a quiet formality in this lovely hotel that feeds your soul.

Reviews.Title: “Slick & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: In Rome I had checked into another property which, after one sleepless night (the room had paper thin walls) and a multitude of other things wrong with the hotel, had been enough! I am a member of the Leaders Club so hastily reserved Hotel Lord Byron. Looking at some of the other reviews I think that I shall deal with the location first. It certainly isn't right in the middle of the action, but then again it isn't that far out at all either. It is right by the Borghese park which has many touristic as well as naturalistic attractions of its own. The quickest way into the city isn't through the park but along one of the roads leading up to the hotel - it is an easy fifteen minute walk downhill to the Plaza Popolo (location of arguably Rome's best property, Hotel De Russie) and then another five - seven minutes to the Spanish Steps. Of course the walk uphill might take you longer, but if you are reasonable capable and not in any tearing hurry this should not present any obstacle in your staying here. If you really are unable to walk then a taxi to/from the Spanish Steps will only cost around 6-7EUR. A plus side of this location is being able to eat in restaurants local to the hotel which are not touristy (nor Michelin starred), being filled with largely local diners. I stayed in a junior suite (photographs of which have been posted by another reviewer) which had almost faultless decor. Lots of high gloss, high quality veneered furniture in an art deco style, red velvetty carpets, and a couple of paintings to tie in with the theme and add some fifties interest (i.e. to remove the 30s themepark feel and to make the whole scheme more eclectic). This was complemented by two terraces, one being rather large with a few pots containing mature orange trees; a most delightful place to relax in the evening. Bathroom was half timbered, think deck from a yacht and the remainder was finished in large marble tiles. If one wanted to be very picky, then the bathroom should've had twin vanities and perhaps a separate shower, which would've been possible had it been arranged in a completely different manner. The deco theme extended to the rest of the hotel, once again objects/paintings from a different era added to the eclectic feel. Overall the property almost gave the impression, particularly in the hallways with the large framed, lacquered veneered doors, of being on a yacht from the 30s. Unfortunately the restaurant, which seems to have a good reputation, was closed during my stay so I could only take breakfast at the property. The usual selection of four or so fruit juices; orange juice was not "freshly squeezed" despite the label aside the jug declaring that it was (this seems to have been the case at this time of year at all the other Italian hotels I stayed at on my trip - so is not a problem unique to this property). Some scrambled egg, bacon, cereals, fresh fruit, tinned fruit, pastries, cheeses, etc. The selection was by no means expansive, but I would describe it as adequate. Compared to another property on my trip (in Naples) the breakfast was vastly inferior. I would recommend that they provide far higher quality pastries instead of some warm croissants and danish pastries, try to use more local Italian cheeses instead of Dutch stuff, and provide a greater variety of fresh fruits. Service throughout my four night stay was excellent. Door and reception staff were extremely patient, professional and helpful. Every wish truly was their command. The maids serviced the rooms extremely well, even laying out and folding night clothes (which had been left on a chair) with the turndown service. Again I would agree with other reviewers that it is a shame that there is no relax/fitness centre - even a room with a few loungers, soft lights, scented candles, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room would be better than nothing. Obviously there are space constraints and it would doubtless mean losing a few bedrooms! If you are after a good value boutiquey property which still offers five star service and amenities and you don't mind being a quarter of an hour's walk from the centre then this is a super little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in the mayhem”
Reviews.Author: biffoBuckinghamshire
Reviews.Content: We used a specialist travel agent and asked for a city hotel that was quiet. They did tell us that this was a reasonable walk across a park to all the attractions - problem with this was that it was about a mile and a half and extremely hot and then there was an additional walk to all the attractions - you need to take a taxi. We had a suite - there are only two with balconies, they advertise that these look over the 'beautiful gardens' well, they do but it is a road first, then high buildings so you get a small glimpse of gardens. The suite was fine but not very good value for money, even in a city hotel, but it was fairly spacious and the staff were nice. The dining room was in a basement and lacked any kind of ambience, we had a cocktail in the bar before going out for dinner one evening, we had to whisper, there was the barman, a piano player and us. Breakfast was very basic and we had to endure lots of Americans that were off the cruise ships, very loud and eating habits not the same as the Brits. The front desk staff were very nice and helpful. One highlight was the hotel car took us to the Tivoli gardens, they were beautiful. Rome was just packed, a hot, crowded nightmare, queues and utter rip off wherever you went. We asked the hotel for a recommendation for dinner one night, they sent us to a restaurant in the centre of Rome, when we got there there were at least 4 other couples from the hotel, it was really quite nice but ended up paying iro £200 for two of us, one starter, two main courses and one pud (we were starving when we left, portion control gone mad) So, to summarise, a quiet, nice hotel away from the noise and crowds but it is a drag every time you want to go sightseeing and don't eat there unless you want to eat alone in a basement!

Reviews.Title: “Style & substance”
Reviews.Author: cpsChester
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Rome. Fantastic hotel: beautiful art deco in every detail. Staff most helpfull. Breakfast, dinner of fantastic quality of produce. The bar: a dream. We went for runs every morning in the Villa Borgese, couldn't have found a better track. It is a short work to the centre, but the quiet nights made more then up for the distance. Warmly welcome the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but very far away”
Reviews.Author: kathyre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Byron for 3 days at the end of May 2008. It is a lovely hotel with warm, welcoming service. The only negative is its distance to anything you want to visit. According to the hotel fact sheet: HOTEL SERVICES AND FACILITIES, include: * Courtesy shuttle service to the city centre/via Veneto, Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Steps & via Condotti We were informed upon arrival that this service had been discontinued. For some this would not matter; however, for my husband who has arthritis in his foot and ankle this was a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: kellyincville
Reviews.Content: I agree completely with what others have said about the Lord Byron. The service is truly top notch and could not be better. But some of the rooms leave something to be desired. Our first room was very small, tacky, had a mediocre view and was overall underwhelming. My husband talked to the front desk and we moved to a different room that was much much better. We ate dinner there one evening as well. The food was ok but the wine selection was excellent and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “nice,quiet,small hotel far from the hubbub of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ewe35
Reviews.Content: Very nice luxury hotel in a leafy section of Rome far from the crowds. Check in staff was very friendly and the room was comfortable and stylish.The breakfast buffet was pretty good.coffee was not hot, but cappucinos were included, although they were a little weak. I was disapponted with the hotels recommendation for dinner.I asked the concierge to recommend a trendy ,glamorous,hot restaurant in Rome. He sent us to a nice,local family restaurant. To my consternation,we met other guests of the restaurant there who came with their strollers and babies. We told him we were in Rome a short time and we really wanted the right place.obviously he sends everyone to the same restaurant no matter what you ask for.He is probably getting a kickback. I was very annoyed. Other things to keep in mind if you are thinking of staying here: This hotel is NOT near the Spanish steps and the tourists sites of Rome. It is a long walk .most people take cabs.You may find it hard to get a cab to take you back to the hotel and after a long day of sightseeing ,you may not feel like walking so far back. Also, this is a luxury hotel but there are no additional services like a fitness center.There are only 2 English language channels on TV, no pay per view movies.you may not care about this,but if you feel like relaxing and watching TV after a long day of touring, your choices are limited.They have no DVD players or Ipod docks either.So bring a book. Allow all, a very nice ,quiet small luxury hotel,far from the hubub of Rome.if that is what you seek, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PRESCENG
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel. Great food in the restaurant. Beds a bit on the hard side but still had a goods nights sleep. Staff all very kind all helpfull. I would go for a bigger room the next time I go. A bit of a walk to the city but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Calm after storm”
Reviews.Author: Zepelin
Reviews.Content: Really a great place to stay in Roma. You want to be in a home sweet home after a walking day. This hotel is the good place. Near the famous villa Borghese in the north center, the hotel is calm, clean and the service above average (a dream : smile & service). 10 minutes from the center of the city in taxi (8-9 €) or 25 minutes walk through the Villa Borghese Park. Choose the luxe room or the suite if you can, the classic is a little bit old fashioned... Choose the Byron Hotel and have a wonderfull trip in the most beautiful antic city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stasha1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in a charming neighborhood near the Borghese Gardens and The Museum of Contempory Art. It is a boutique hotel with a very intimate and elegant feeling. The staff was very attentive and the room was elegant, yet understated. I highly recommend this hotel for a peaceful getaway in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “cute!”
Reviews.Author: RicardoMilan
Reviews.Content: beautiful location, lovely area , leafy , incredible buildings. decor of the hotel is very cute, some bits are a little dated and need attention but overal experience very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “A long-time favorite”
Reviews.Author: funvoyage
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Rome for years and the Lord Byron is one of my favorites places to stay. The Lord Byron is fantastic because it feels like home, the staff dotes on you and it genuinely cares, the restaurant is exceptional and the hotel is a welcomed escape from the regular commotion of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend for 2”
Reviews.Author: Generallyamewsing
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the Lord Byron Hotel. We were collected by the hotel Merc and very comfortably delivered to the hotel (worth every penny). Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Deluxe Double, which was welcomed as the Classic doubles are on the small side. The hotel's most redeeming feature is the high level of service. All of the staff are exceedingly helpful and courteous and willing to go out of their way to help. The rooms were regularly cleaned with sheets and towels changed daily (sometimes more often depending upon level of activity!). My only complaint would be that the décor of the rooms and some of the furniture could be described as a little tacky. For a 5 Star hotel, one perhaps would expect a higher level of luxury. The floor to ceiling wall carpeting is not to everyone’s taste, including this callsign. The televisions look as though they date back to the nineties. Indeed, they could do with more luxury creature comforts such as a DVD/HiFi player, etc. However, despite my mutterings, my girlfriend and I had an incredibly romantic weekend. It is indeed a cliché (and the hotel's motto), but the hotel really did feel like a home where we were welcomed by friends as we entered. Location wise, it is a tad far away from the centre, but we welcomed walking off the gastronomic excesses by strolling through the beautiful park that is Villa Borghese. All in all, a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet escape....”
Reviews.Author: SSheets
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay at the new sister hotel of Lord Byron but problems with the opening meant we were re-booked into the Byron. Lord Byron is a beautiful quiet little hotel with attentive and really nice staff and a nice restaurant. Not for those who like the hustle and bustle or extensive leisure facilities of the larger hotels but a super escape from the hustle and bustle of Rome. Very close to the beautiful Villa Borghese park and museum - but a little bit of a walk to the main tourist traps. This one is a little gem. 20 minute plus walks to Vatican, Town Centre, Forum etc - and the hotel is atop of a steep hill - may be not suitable for those with mobility problems. Taxis easy though and the hotel has an hourly (10am until 6pm) shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Service was the best attribute”
Reviews.Author: I10driver
Reviews.Content: The service and staff were great. My advice is stay on the lower floors during summer months because the air condition has trouble reaching up to the top two (5th and 6th) floors when the temperatures are in the 30's C. The rooms all have different decor, some are luxurious and some are kind of tacky. The food is excellent. The location is quiet and they have a free shuttle to some of the popular places but it is too far to walk to any tourist destinations. Again my thanks for the service and the experience was good but not 5 star as was billed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: garydc71
Reviews.Content: So far I cannot believe the level of service I have received from this hotel, and I have not even checked in yet! I am booked for a trip the first week of June. I would like to thank the Front Desk Manager and the Concierge Manager for going above and beyond to accommodate my requests. I had some challenges trying to change a reservation I made on the hotel website to a Fine Hotel and Resort reservation. (In order to recieve the Aminities provided by AMEX). Melita and Laura have really gone above and beyond my expectations. They are so kind and sincere in their effort to provide outstanding service. I am looking forward to my visit to Rome and particularly my stay at the Lord Byron. I will be sure to update my review on my return.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Katya525
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy. I booked the whole trip myself by researching first at the library using Frommers ect. and then by going on tripadvisor to contact various hotels that looked like a good match. Our first stop was in Rome, and the Lord Byron was our first hotel. Everything about this hotel was fantastic. The service from the time I called from the states to the time we left on the train to Florence was excellent. They were so patient with me as I am quite picky!! Although it is a little off the beaten path of downtown Rome, this place is worth it. After a long day of site seeing and shopping it was such a pleasure to be back at this little gem of a hotel. On one night my husband and I went down to the bar in the hotel which is just the right size and a group of very attractive Roman women were assembled. One of the ladies got up and started what seemed like acting out a play to her friends. As my husband and I don't speak the language we were not able to understand, but you couldn't take your eyes off of her. It turns out she was quoting Donte to her friends! One of the ladies was the owners' wife, and she was so gracious to us. The rooms are gorgeous, the staff is helpful without being in your face, and the food was fantastic!! There is so much more I can write about this hotel, all of which would be positive!! We also stayed at the sister hotel the Regency in Forence consitant with the Lord Byron, it was also a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BrianNicholas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in October with a friend of mine for four evenings. It exceeded our expectations in many ways. The rooms were immaculately clean and well laid out. Upon arriving we were immediately greeted by name and told we would be upgraded to a Junior suite. This was a godsend seeing as how standard rooms in major cities can be on the smaller side. The room was large enough for two people, it had a balcony overlooking the front of the property and a large, marble tiled bathroom. The front desk staff and the concierge were all very helpful in pointing out local restaurants and sights to see. Since breakfast was included in our booking, we made an effort to get downstairs each morning. There were always fresh pastries, fruits, breads, etc. and the wait staff was professional and courteous. The only caveat I have for this hotel is the location. It is on the outskirts of the city center in a suburb near Villa Borghese. It was expensive to constantly take taxis to and from the major sights and the walk is brisk, no shorter than 30 minutes, uphill and we are active twenty-somethings. Also, be sure to leave in plenty of time at the taxi queue down the street when under a time constraint. We almost missed our tour of the Vatican Scavi waiting for a cab amongst businessmen and other tourists for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GlamTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time to Rome and it was a romantic weekend getaway for my husband and me. We were very happy with the look and feel of the hotel and the service was excellent. Our room was good sized and large by Rome standards with elegant decor, a big tub and big fluffy towels. Our beds were turned down every evening with complimentary slippers placed next to the bed. We both thought the hotel bar was very cool but we were slightly disappointed with the Sapori restaurant. The service was excellent, appetizers were great, the wine and deserts were to die for but both of our entrees were a big disappointment, especially considering the prices and glowing recommendations. One other small, nit-picky item: To add to the luxury feel of our weekend we paid extra to have a private sedan pick us up and drop us off at the train station (45 euros each way vs. 10 for a cab). We were picked up in a Mercedes sedan, which we loved, but our trip back was in a minivan (we were told there were no sedans available)--it would have been better to just get a cab. This wasn't really the fault of the hotel but the hotel called this company for us and it's a small thing to be aware of if you ask for this service. This hotel is off the beaten path and definitely not central to Rome, but since we had previously done a big sight-seeing trip this was perfect for us. The hotel is a short, easy walk to most of the museums in the Borghese gardens but not much else. It's not difficult to get into central Rome, however, with the hotel's complimentary shuttle (a 5-minute ride) which drops you off a block from Via Venetto and 3-4 blocks from the Spanish Steps. Be aware, the last shuttle bus to the hotel was at 6:15pm during our stay. Cabs into town are not that expensive though. We had dinner one night near the Piazza Navona and we paid 10 Euros each way (including tip) for a cab ride. All in all it was a lovely experience and I would stay here again for a relaxing, romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Info not quite right!”
Reviews.Author: JSK998
Reviews.Content: Stayed 27.3.06 to 31.3.06., Brochure / internet site say ALL rooms have Queen or twin rooms. Room 307 has normal 4' 6" bed, pretty small when used to a 6' bed at home. Mind it shares the largest balcony above the main entrance. The complimentary shuttle bus was never mentioned or offered to us throughtout our stay and the 15 minute walk to the centre must be for persons of Olympic stature, not normal persons. You start on top of one hill, travel through two valley's and over two further hills, before descending into the north end of the city centre. Walking through the Villa Borghese grounds is NOT recommended from dusk onwards. One evening at dusk it took us 50 minutes to walk round the eastern perimter of the grounds to the Spanish Steps. The internet site claims that you MAY have a city view or Villa Borghese view. Looking south west, from the front door you view the sold wall of the Belgium Embassy. Looking south east you view an apartment block. Looking north east you view beautiful old very expensive houses and north west is another block of apartments. Minor but very important inaccuracies in the hotel literature that need correcting. The look and feel of the hotel is very good, but not excellent because of the little things mentioned above. No matter was to insignificant for the excellent staff that we encountered, especially from Monday to Thursday. Be aware that Italian businessmen at breakfast like to talk loudly on their mobile phones. Overall, premises should rate 5 star, but this is reduced to 3.5 by the matters already mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, don't miss the SAPORI restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time, lovely staff and enjoyed one of the best stays in Rome. I suggest that anyone travelling to Rome experience this grand hotel. There is a courtesy shuttle bringing you downtown (even if the hotel is not far from Via Veneto) and my children were happy to discover the restaurant has delicious dishes. We had a very pleasant experience as arrived very early in the morning and they kindly allowed us the get our rooms upon arrrival. The staff was helpful and anticipated us at all times. Another couple staying at the hotel at the same time reported it was their sixth stay at the hotel! We enjoyed eating the delicous Italian specialties at SAPORI rest. and discovered they mainly use organic meat and vegetables. We'll try their Florence hotel as we indeed were impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelMaven9867
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great staff, wonderful location. A retreat away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel at home. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE RUBBISH!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DO NOT be misled. This hotel is NOT in the centre of Rome. It is NOT within walking distance of the city. The rooms are small and our wardrobe was located ABOVE the bed which required you to use a long pole to access it. It is NOT a Leading Hotel of the World

Reviews.Title: “Risk it and you will likely love it”
Reviews.Author: CintiKid
Reviews.Content: After seeing a few Tripadvisor reviews that panned the Lord Byron, I expected problems ... but they were tiny compared to the grandeur of this small luxury hotel. (so the room wasn't quite ready when promised and the doorman was helping someone else when we arrived). Elegant service at lunch by the bar, delighful (smallish) room - (but this is central Rome). Convenient to Borghese Gallery and Gardens and also to good travel agent nearby who spoke a bit of English. Breakfast a delight and early enough for us. Loved the architecture - all white in a setting of surrounding color. Not bad location for taxi to main train station either. The limo arranged from airpost was expensive but most competently safe and a pleasant driver.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Hamill
Reviews.Content: This hotel was serious disappointment. We booked through LHW as always, but this hotel should not be on there. The hotel is miles from anywhere and the description on LHW which claims it is a 'leisurely stroll' is simply untrue. The staff were cold and unfriendly, the rooms are very small with strange decor and storage. Don't stay at this hotel, above all else it is a nightmare to travel to and from, especially late at night when taxis are scarce.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated & Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Lord Byron is a delight! My husband and I are frequent travellers to Rome and simply fell in love with this exquisite boutique hotel from the first moment we arrived. It is new, it is fresh, welcoming and perfect for a relaxing, pleasurable stay in the city. It has a great location at the edge of the Borghese Gardens which enabled us to benefit from a quiet, quality night’s rest (not always the case at many of the other top properties). The restaurant offers an outrageous selection of top Italian cuisine and presents honest prices. Our only regret was to have discovered the treasure on our second to last night. We will be sure to not make the same mistake the next time.

Reviews.Title: “watch out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Byron in June and we were most disappointed. I agree it is not a leading hotel in any regard at all. Our room was a nightmare in red with a window that opened inward! The bathroom was too small. A terry toweling shower curtain was a sight to behold and the toilet blocked which just about made our stay! But the worse was to come when we found the hotel had charged us twice! We did not become aware of this until we were in london and our credit card was rejected by an ATM. This was a real inconvenience and the hotels response was 'so what?' The location was a pain and the breakfast lacking in variety and quality. I recommend a less expensive hotel in a more central location, at least you won't feel too ripped off!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I take issue with the Lord Byron being included as a "Leading Hotel of the World" as I saw nothing to merit it. The room was tiny - so small in fact there was no room for proper closets. Instead, the "closets" were 2 large wall cabinets mounted on either side of the bed. A pole was attached to the hanging bar which you lowered out & into the room to hang your clothes. This was the strangest set-up I have ever seen. Once you had unpacked and hung your clothes, you were free to enjoy the 3 foot wide U of floor space surrounding the bed. Outside of the room, I agree with the previous review re: the out of the way location, medicore breakfast and uncomfortable feeling of the bar/public space. With all the great hotels in Rome, don't bother with the Lord Byron.
